Rather than lose both rook and pawn, I’ll give up the g-pawn immediately and at least trade it for the queen – a sacrifice that will leave me with rook-and-minor-piece versus queen, a position that is still very playable.

rounds.response:
Black has finally developed his knight to g3, but at the price of an exchange-backed fork on it.  
Because his queen left that square, material equality is restored and the knight on g3 is left hanging.  
I can win it instantly – I can even choose between pawn and rook capture.

Rook capture keeps the rook alive and opens the f-file for me, so:

[f1g3]
